intro: Rosa sepium var. rakovacensis, commonly known as the Rakovac rose, is a rare and unique variant of the Rosa sepium species. It is characterized by its deep red to purple flowers and dark green, velvety foliage. This plant is native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans, particularly in Croatia. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a botanically significant and endangered species.
